main

Class SensorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.SensorManager

  • public class SensorManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The SensorManager manages all the methods responsible for interacting with the ultrasonic sensor and light sensors.
    Version:
    Final 1.0.5
    Author:
    Connor Fowlie, David Castonguay, Lucas Bluethner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      LightPollerL lightLeftPoller 
      LightPollerR lightRightPoller 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getColor()
      Returns the front facing light sensors current color as an int.
      ColorPoller getColorPoller()
      Returns the current instance of the ColorPoller.
      int getDistance()
      Returns Ultrasonic Sensors distance in cm
      double getEuclidColor()
      Uses the Euclidean color from the forward facing light sensor to detect distance from a block.
      static SensorManager getInstance()
      Get singleton method, call this to access the sensor manager.
      LightPollerL getLightPollerL()
      Returns the current instance of LightPollerL.
      LightPollerR getLightPollerR()
      Returns the current instance of LightPollerR.
      int getLine()
      Returns int if currently over a line: 0 = No line, 1 = Left Line, 2 = Right Line, 3 = Both Lines.
      boolean getLineL()
      Returns true if the left light sensor is currently over a line.
      boolean getLineR()
      Returns true if the right light sensor is currently over a line.
      Odometer getOdometer()
      Returns the current instance of the Odometer.
      UltrasonicPoller getUsPoller()

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        Returns Ultrasonic Sensors distance in cm
        Returns:
        integer ultrasonic sensor distance

      • getLine

        public int getLine()
        Returns int if currently over a line: 0 = No line, 1 = Left Line, 2 = Right Line, 3 = Both Lines.
        Returns:
        0 if neither sensor is over a line, 1 if left sensor is over a line, 2 if right sensor is over a line, and 3 if both sensor are over a line

      • getLineR

        public boolean getLineR()
        Returns true if the right light sensor is currently over a line.
        Returns:
        true if a line is detected; false otherwise.

      • getLineL

        public boolean getLineL()
        Returns true if the left light sensor is currently over a line.
        Returns:
        true if a line is detected; false otherwise.

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Returns the front facing light sensors current color as an int.
        Returns:
        color from the collorPoller as an integer value.

      • getEuclidColor

        public double getEuclidColor()
        Uses the Euclidean color from the forward facing light sensor to detect distance from a block.
        Returns:
        Euclidean color from the colorPoller
